<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bitsetinfo">BitSetInfo</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bitsetbuilder/#aa21d510ab0919fcc10fbbb02ead13dab">build</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class implements a layout algorithm for globals referenced by bit sets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that tries to keep members of small bit sets together. This can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// significantly reduce bit set sizes in many cases.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It works by assembling fragments of layout from sets of referenced globals.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each set of referenced globals causes the algorithm to create a new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fragment, which is assembled by appending each referenced global in the set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// into the fragment. If a referenced global has already been referenced by an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fragment created earlier, we instead delete that fragment and append its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// contents into the fragment we are assembling.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// By starting with the smallest fragments, we minimize the size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fragments that are copied into larger fragments. This is most intuitively</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// thought about when considering the case where the globals are virtual tables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and the bit sets represent their derived classes: in a single inheritance</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// hierarchy, the optimum layout would involve a depth-first search of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class hierarchy (and in fact the computed layout ends up looking a lot like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a DFS), but a naive DFS would not work well in the presence of multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inheritance. This aspect of the algorithm ends up fitting smaller</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// hierarchies inside larger ones where that would be beneficial.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For example, consider this class hierarchy:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A       B</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   \\   / | \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     C   D   E</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We have five bit sets: bsA (A, C), bsB (B, C, D, E), bsC (C), bsD (D) and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bsE (E). If we laid out our objects by DFS traversing B followed by A, our</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// layout would be &#123;B, C, D, E, A&#125;. This is optimal for bsB as it needs to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cover the only 4 objects in its hierarchy, but not for bsA as it needs to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cover 5 objects, i.e. the entire layout. Our algorithm proceeds as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Add bsC, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Add bsD, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Add bsE, fragments &#123;&#123;C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;, &#123;E&#125;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Add bsA, fragments &#123;&#123;A, C&#125;, &#123;D&#125;, &#123;E&#125;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Add bsB, fragments &#123;&#123;B, A, C, D, E&#125;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This layout is optimal for bsA, as it now only needs to cover two (i.e. 3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fewer) objects, at the cost of bsB needing to cover 1 more object.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The bit set lowering pass assigns an object index to each object that needs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to be laid out, and calls addFragment for each bit set passing the object</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// indices of its referenced globals. It then assembles a layout from the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// computed layout in the Fragments field.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd">GlobalLayoutBuilder</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The computed layout. Each element of this vector contains a fragment of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// layout (which may be empty) consisting of object indices.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;std::vector&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668">Fragments</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Mapping from object index to fragment index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be">FragmentMap</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a2354a7882002ba4c12cd5f3be8dba7dd">GlobalLayoutBuilder</a>(uint64&#95;t NumObjects)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#a5d2e54b342691d69ccfc9e799d404668">Fragments</a>(1), <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#ad3e6889c1625ade2687b7fee501f64be">FragmentMap</a>(NumObjects) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add F to the layout while trying to keep its indices contiguous.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If a previously seen fragment uses any of F&#39;s indices, that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// fragment will be laid out inside F.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/globallayoutbuilder/#abc53ed9289ca61898a56ea65b8a457db">addFragment</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::set&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class is used to build a byte array containing overlapping bit sets. By</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loading from indexed offsets into the byte array and applying a mask, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// program can test bits from the bit set with a relatively short instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sequence. For example, suppose we have 15 bit sets to lay out:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A (16 bits), B (15 bits), C (14 bits), D (13 bits), E (12 bits),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// F (11 bits), G (10 bits), H (9 bits), I (7 bits), J (6 bits), K (5 bits),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// L (4 bits), M (3 bits), N (2 bits), O (1 bit)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// These bits can be laid out in a 16-byte array like this:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       Byte Offset</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     0123456789ABCDEF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   7 HHHHHHHHHIIIIIII</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   6 GGGGGGGGGGJJJJJJ</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   5 FFFFFFFFFFFKKKKK</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   4 EEEEEEEEEEEELLLL</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   3 DDDDDDDDDDDDDMMM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   2 CCCCCCCCCCCCCCNN</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   1 BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBO</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   0 AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For example, to test bit X of A, we evaluate ((bits&#91;X&#93; &amp; 1) != 0), or to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// test bit X of I, we evaluate ((bits&#91;9 + X&#93; &amp; 0x80) != 0). This can be done</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in 1-2 machine instructions on x86, or 4-6 instructions on ARM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a byte array, rather than (say) a 2-byte array or a 4-byte array,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// because for one thing it gives us better packing (the more bins there are,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the less evenly they will be filled), and for another, the instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sequences can be slightly shorter, both on x86 and ARM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee">ByteArrayBuilder</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The byte array built so far.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#ab9bf25f047271def1203635a5725eeff"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#ab9bf25f047271def1203635a5725eeff">Bytes</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca">BitsPerByte</a> = 8 &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The number of bytes allocated so far for each of the bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>&#91;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a456d9afc9af28332a92e0a67cbbc7098a961b1f972e23c16ecc4ddffe1ddfbdca">BitsPerByte</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a7e7d04e07fc7f640097f08663ec3ccee">ByteArrayBuilder</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlight">    memset(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>, 0, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">sizeof</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#a49082c502ad79672b9f721424779a643">BitAllocs</a>));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocate BitSize bits in the byte array where Bits contains the bits to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// set. AllocByteOffset is set to the offset within the byte array and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// AllocMask is set to the bitmask for those bits. This uses the LPT (Longest</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Processing Time) multiprocessor scheduling algorithm to lay out the bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// efficiently; the pass allocates bit sets in decreasing size order.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/lowertypetests/bytearraybuilder/#aefcc42b423b9473d155867e579682a9e">allocate</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::set&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; &amp;Bits, uint64&#95;t BitSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlight">                uint64&#95;t &amp;AllocByteOffset, uint8&#95;t &amp;AllocMask);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#ab6535371eaec8620c84bbb0689535dbb">isJumpTableCanonical</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Specifies how to drop type tests.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83ada"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum class</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83ada">DropTestKind</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754">None</a>,   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Do not drop type tests (default).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa4822c96fc1eebe031cde975d10a29e12"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaa4822c96fc1eebe031cde975d10a29e12">Assume</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Drop only llvm.assumes using type test value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaab1c94ca2fbc3e78fc30069c8d0f01680"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/lowertypetests/#a28baf2df0f23eab12b60755416e83adaab1c94ca2fbc3e78fc30069c8d0f01680">All</a>,    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Drop the type test and all uses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace lowertypetests</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lowertypetestspass"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lowertypetestspass/#a0da2382d9008c7a7b6f9c77f7282a0a0">LowerTypeTestsPass</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/passinfomixin">PassInfoMixin</a>&lt;LowerTypeTestsPass&gt; &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> UseCommandLine = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulesummaryindex">ModuleSummaryIndex</a> &#42;ImportSummary = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
